doc.after: Torpedo Boat Destroyer designs continued to evolve around the turn of the 20th century in several key ways The first was the introduction of the steam turbine The spectacular unauthorized demonstration of the turbine powered Turbinia at the 1897 Spithead Navy Review which significantly was of torpedo boat size prompted the Royal Navy to order a prototype turbine powered destroyer HMS Viper of 1899 This was the first turbine warship of any kind and achieved a remarkable 36 knots 67 km h on sea trials By 1910 the turbine had been widely adopted by all navies for their faster ships
